Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1

Hi Gordon,

Thanks for your reply.  I am using H1.14.4.  The fields that I am changing
in particular are keyword, mysql server, mysql database, mysql user, mysql
password. The control interface you are asking (if I am thinking of the
same thing) is via xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx:8080 which is the heritrix admin console.

I attached a screenshot, but I don't know if it will be accessible inside
the group.

Based on your questions, I am thinking incorrectly.  I presumed that being
able to change extractor fields inside the console is standard Heritrix
function by virtue of the extractor being selected as a (writer) processor
in the module tab.

I am starting to understand that while I can change Heritrix configuration
settings within the console, custom extractor specific fields though
appearing inside the console are not functional without additional
programming to hand off the changes to the .java file and thus recompiling
of the extractor.

I figured that since I can copy/paste URL seeds directly into the console,
I could also change the other fields presented to me as well.

It would be nice to change the fields on the fly inside Heritrix rather
than going into the .java file for each run requiring new keyword or mysql
credentials( what I do now).  I realize I'll have to pay for that
convenience and talk to my developer if I get to the point of doing
numerous custom keyword/mysql projects.

Thanks for helping me with this insight.

David

--f46d040167a1ed708c04c6c6a261
Content-Type: text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
